meanings.definition: To join or connect (ropes, wires, etc.) by interweaving the strands.
meanings.sent1: I am splicing the ropes to make them longer.
meanings.sent2: The electrician is splicing the wires to extend the circuit.
meanings.sent3: The magician performed a trick by splicing two ropes into one.
meanings.sent4: Her storytelling skills are so good, it's like she can splice words together seamlessly.
meanings.sent5: The art of splicing is essential for creating strong connections.

meanings.sent1: We are splicing our efforts to achieve a common goal.
meanings.sent2: The two families decided to splice their lands for a bigger farm.
meanings.sent3: The chef decided to splice unusual ingredients together for a unique dish.
meanings.sent4: Their friendship is so strong, it's like they can splice their minds together.
meanings.sent5: Splicing our strengths will make us unbeatable.

meanings.definition: The act of joining or connecting.
meanings.sent1: The splicing of the cables was done carefully to avoid any errors.
meanings.sent2: The splicing of the two rivers created a beautiful new waterway.
meanings.sent3: The splicing of ideas from different fields led to a groundbreaking invention.
meanings.sent4: In the world of music, the splicing of genres can create amazing new sounds.
meanings.sent5: The splicing of cultures enriches our society.
